---
title: "RGL2HTML"
output: html_document
---
```{r setup}
library(knitr)
options(rgl.useNULL=TRUE) #!
library(rgl)
knit_hooks$set(webgl = hook_webgl)
```

```{r, test-rgl, webgl=TRUE}
x <- sort(rnorm(1000))
y <- rnorm(1000)
z <- rnorm(1000) + atan2(x,y)
plot3d(x, y, z, col = rainbow(1000))
```

This file just demonstrates how to embed an rgl interactive visualization into html.  

It does work with the aerothlon.R script but only in hq = FALSE mode. (In hq = TRUE mode pandoc eats up GBs of memory and crashes...)
